dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon
News Content: Nvidia (NVDA)

Chipmaker Nvidia has overtaken Apple (AAPL) once again to become the world's most valuable company, after the company's shares rose in Tuesday's session.

Nvidia now has a market capitalisation of nearly $3.45tn (£2.79tn), compared to Apple's $3.35tn, with shares in the iPhone maker having fallen 3% in the previous session.

Shares in Nvidia climbed more than 2% on Tuesday and were up 2.5% in pre-market trading on Wednesday.

This came after newly reinstated president Donald Trump announced a new $500bn private sector investment to build artificial infrastructure in the US.

Read more: FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks rise as UK borrowing jumps unexpectedly

Initial equity funders for the "Stargate Project" are OpenAI, Oracle (ORCL), SoftBank (9984.T) and MGX, while Nvidia is one of the initial technology partners.

Ben Barringer, technology analyst at Quilter Cheviot, said: "This development is undeniably a boon for the AI sector. Companies involved in supplying the technology and infrastructure for Project Stargate are well-positioned to benefit significantly.

"The move underscores the increasing strategic importance of AI innovation, further solidifying its role as a cornerstone of economic and technological advancement. For investors in the AI space, this announcement highlights a wealth of opportunities as the competition to dominate the sector intensifies."

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Oracle (ORCL)

Shares in Oracle jumped 7% on Tuesday and were up 8% in pre-market trading on Wednesday morning, following Trump's announcement.

The stock was also trending after Trump reportedly said at event on Tuesday that he would be open to Oracle chairman Larry Ellison or Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk purchasing social media app TikTok, as part of a joint venture with the US government.

According to a Bloomberg report, Trump said: "I have the right to make a deal."

"So what I’m thinking about saying to somebody is buy it and give half to the United States of America, half, and we’ll give you the permit, and they’ll have a great partner," he added.

Read more: Pound, gold and oil prices in focus: commodity and currency check, 22 January

In one of his early actions after being sworn in for a second presidential term on Monday, Trump signed an executive order to delay the ban of TikTok in the US.

When asked about Trump's proposal that TikTok-owner, Chinese company ByteDance, hand over half of the platform to a US company, China foreign ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said: "TikTok has operated in the US for years and been very popular with American users."

Story Continues

"It has played a positive role in boosting US employment and consumption. We hope the US will earnestly listen to the voice of reason and provide an open, fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for market entities from all countries."

•USD

(ORCL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Netflix (NFLX)

Shares in Netflix soared 14% in pre-market trading on Wednesday, after the streaming giant reported 18.9 million users in the fourth quarter, with revenue and earnings also beating expectations.

Revenue of $8.83bn for the fourth quarter was up 12.5% year-on-year and diluted earnings per share came in at $2.11 for the final three months of its fiscal year.

The company also announced a $15bn share buyback and raised its full-year revenue outlook to come in between $43.5bn and $44.5bn. That was ahead of its prior range of $43bn to $44bn.

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

Strong subscriber gains came on the back of Netflix ending 2024 with two back-to-back NFL games, a successful "Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson" boxing match, and the return of the highly-popular "Squid Game" series.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "Netflix keeps us hooked with fresh content slates, drawing millions of new viewers while keeping existing customers happy at the same time. This is the last quarter Netflix will report net subscriber growth, and it’s blown expectations out of the water.

"While rivals hike prices and wrestle with losses, Netflix is raking in cash and striking deals like WWE and NFL to strengthen its lineup. Competitors selling their best shows to Netflix only make its library stronger, keeping us watching – and, crucially, paying."

•USD

(NFLX)

Follow  View Quote Details

Adidas (ADS.DE)

In Europe, shares in sportswear brand Adidas surged nearly 7% on Wednesday morning, after the company posted stronger-than-expected preliminary fourth quarter results.

Adidas revenues grew 24% to €5.97bn (£5.05tn) in the fourth quarter, while operating profit reached €57m in the quarter, versus an operating loss of €377m.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

The jump in the shares helped drive the pan-European STOXX 600 (^STOXX) to an all-time high on Wednesday morning.

Deutsche Bank analysts said in a note on Wednesday that they had a "buy" rating on the stock.

"Our buy case on Adidas is built on increasing brand heat, positive earnings momentum and strong EPS growth," they said. "All of this is evidenced again in 4Q."

•USD

(ADS.DE)

Follow  View Quote Details

JD Wetherspoon (JDW.L)

Shares in UK pub operator JD Wetherspoon dipped nearly 2% into the red on Wednesday, after the company's chairman Tim Martin warned of higher costs.

Martin had already warned that costs at Wetherspoons would increase this year by £60m per annum, on the back of increases in the autumn budget to employer national insurance contributions and the national minimum wage.

Read more: Higher-than-expected UK borrowing heaps pressure on Rachel Reeves

"Government-mandated wage increases have a significantly bigger impact on pub and restaurant companies than supermarkets," Martin said.

Derren Nathan, head of equity research at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "There’s no more vociferous campaigner for landlord rights than chairman Tim Martin who has pointed out that volumes of pub’s biggest product line, beer, have collapsed by 52% between 2000 and 2023.

"Average on-trade prices are now at £4.98 per pint and far more sensitive to labour cost increases than supermarket equivalents, where you can pick up 568 ml of refreshment for an average price of £1.20."

In the trading update, JD Wetherspoon reported 5.1% growth in like-for-like sales.

•USD

(JDW.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

Arm Holdings (ARM)

Apple (AAPL)

Kia (000270.KS)

Procter & Gamble (PG)

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The opening of the Apple Miami Worldcenter store is a positive development for Apple Inc., as it enhances their retail presence in a vibrant market and aligns with their commitment to sustainability and accessibility. The store's features, such as the dedicated Apple Pickup area and community engagement events, are likely to attract customers and drive sales, particularly with the launch of new products like the iPhone 16. This news is expected to have a favorable impact on investor sentiment, leading to a higher probability of stock price increase. However, the overall market conditions and other external factors could still influence stock performance, hence a balanced probability assessment is provided.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article presents a generally positive outlook for the Nasdaq 100, driven by strong performance of technology stocks, including Apple. Evercore ISI's Rich Ross anticipates the rally to continue, supported by positive technical signals. While rising bond yields initially posed a threat, they have since retreated. The article highlights Apple's upcoming earnings report as a key event. Technical analysts are watching for Apple to 'catch a bid' as it nears its 200-DMA, suggesting potential upward momentum. The overall sentiment is bullish for tech, which should positively impact Apple. However, the article also mentions potential risks like the Fed's policy decision and the possibility of pullbacks. Considering these factors, I estimate a higher probability of a stock price rise than a fall, but not overwhelmingly so, given the inherent uncertainties in the market.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on other companies, with Apple's mention being incidental to Nvidia surpassing it as the most valuable company.  Apple's stock fell 3% in the previous session, and the news doesn't offer any specific positive catalysts for Apple. While the overall market sentiment might be positive due to the AI investment news and strong performances from other tech companies, this is not directly related to Apple's performance.  The probability of a price rise is therefore low, while the probability of a fall or sideways movement is higher, given the recent 3% drop and lack of positive news specific to Apple.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news primarily discusses Intel's (INTC) challenges in finding a new CEO and its strategic missteps, which are internal issues specific to Intel. While the article mentions Apple's (AAPL) internal chip head Johny Srouji as a potential candidate for Intel's CEO role, this is unlikely to have a direct or significant impact on Apple's stock price. Apple is not the focus of the news, and the mention of Srouji is speculative. Therefore, the news is neutral for Apple, with no clear catalyst for a stock price movement.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is the worst-performing Dow Jones stock so far in 2025, which suggests a negative trend. However, the headline also questions if the sell-off presents a buying opportunity, which implies potential for recovery. The negative performance trend might increase the likelihood of a further stock price fall as it could signal continued investor skepticism. On the other hand, if investors perceive the sell-off as an overreaction or an opportunity to buy at a lower price, the stock price might rise. Given the current negative trend, there seems to be a higher likelihood of the stock price falling in the short term, but the mention of a potential buying opportunity suggests some potential for a rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline 'Should You Buy Apple Stock Before Jan. 30?' suggests that there might be an upcoming event or announcement related to Apple Inc. on January 30, which could potentially impact the stock price. Without specific details about the event, it's difficult to determine the direction of the impact. However, the fact that the question is being asked implies there could be some level of anticipation or speculation about the event's potential to positively affect the stock. Given this, there's a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising due to potential positive speculation or anticipation leading up to the event, compared to falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news indicates that Samsung, a direct competitor in the smartphone market, is entering the augmented reality (AR) glasses market with a partnership with Google. This could increase competition for Apple in the AR sector, potentially impacting Apple's market share and future revenue streams. However, the news also highlights the ongoing challenges in developing AR glasses, which might signal that the market is still in its early stages and that Apple continues to have time to develop its own product. The market may interpret this news negatively, leading to a potential short-term dip in Apple's stock price.

Considering these factors, and the previous rounds of predictions, I estimate a higher probability of a stock price rise than a fall, but not overwhelmingly so, given the inherent uncertainties in the market. While positive news about the AI sector and other tech companies (Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix) might create a generally positive market sentiment, there's no direct positive catalyst for Apple in this news. The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, highlighting the uncertainty surrounding Apple's short-term prospects.  The lack of specific positive news for Apple, coupled with its recent decline, suggests a higher probability of a continued downward trend or sideways movement in the short term.  However, the overall market positivity could partially offset this negative sentiment.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news focuses on other companies' strong performances, particularly Nvidia surpassing Apple in market capitalization.  While the overall positive sentiment in the tech sector due to AI investment might indirectly benefit Apple, the news itself lacks direct positive catalysts for Apple. Apple's recent 3% drop is also mentioned.  Previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, reflecting uncertainty.  The lack of Apple-specific positive news, coupled with its recent decline and the overwhelmingly positive news for competitors, suggests a higher probability of a continued downward trend or sideways movement. The consensus from previous models leans slightly towards a price fall.  However, the general market positivity could partially offset this negative sentiment. I'm weighting the lack of positive Apple-specific news more heavily than the general market optimism, leading to a slightly higher probability of a price fall than a rise.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.35,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.65
}
```
